name: International Inn and Suites on Cape Cod

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What could be better than staying at a Cuddle & Bubble on The Cape, right? Like you, we were looking forward to a relaxing, romantic getaway filled with pampering as we enjoyed the amenities of our “elegantly appointed suite”. Well, let me tell you, the most beautiful thing about the International Inn & Suites is their marketing. Bravo, advertising team, Bravo.
reviews.title: A Real Review of The International Inn & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to go on the assumption that The International, which by the way is about as international as IHOP, caters to suckers who are first time visitors. There is absolutely no way they have repeat business unless the guests have forcibly spent time in a hospital for a violent crime.
reviews.title: Run far away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the address we insisted we must be in the wrong place. The “J” shaped two-story building looked perfectly suitable for drug deals or a seedy adulteress rendezvous. I purposely did not say after-prom local, although fitting, as the price probably prohibits the kids from making the same bad decision we did.
reviews.title: Tacky, smelly, and ... just icky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in with the same fanfare you might expect to receive at a Motel 6; perhaps not as friendly. With room key, map to room, and keypad code in hand we made our way back outside and drove the 50 feet to our room. No problem finding a parking spot on a holiday weekend. Along the way we passed the pool which was closed due to the cool weather but not necessarily. It was covered and surrounded by a chain link fence that looked like it could be knocked over by a sneeze from all the dust on the pool cover. There was no poolside bar as described on the website so I imagine they just throw out a cooler full of Budweiser and call it a bar.
reviews.title: DIRTY, RUNDOWN, TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was happy that we had a secure entry code to the building entrance. I would have been happier to feel I didn’t have to worry about being murdered in my sleep but for now I would settle for the code.
reviews.title: I'll Never let Curiousity Manipulate Me Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whe booked a stay here for 2 nights for $93 including breakfast so what can you expect. A spacious room with two trampoline beds (watch your head when you jump on them!) a otherwise old building in need of renovation. Bathroom/shower was okay and clean. Breakfast was well what can i say a poor show, scrambled eggs made of powder and all other food was packaged the good thing where the fresh apples.
reviews.title: Cheap night out...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: All in all had a fine stay, but would certainly not recommend this place for a romantic getaway or anything.
reviews.title: Rude management!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: I paid hundreds for a weekend found mold in my room received upgrade looked like a serious down grade! Talked to vinny "head of engineering" my 14 year son knows more and more helfull so i try to sleep and find bedbugs discusted night person tells me its fine there just cochroaches stunned i went to another hotel in morning went see the manager savi tells me no refunds tells me I'm a liar they robb people others were trying to get money back also unbelievable also could see and hear her screaming at an employee for offering a refund unbelievable she neefs a new line of work! Stay away only good thing that uy Vinnie told me about cape codder!
reviews.title: Nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a great spot if you want to be in the center of Hyannis. It is kind of dirty and has that cheap motel stank. But is pretty cheap for the cape.
reviews.title: Well its not the Hilton, but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was suprised by some of the comments in the past reviews, but some of them I wasn't. My husband and I stayed here as a get away. Having 2 children with autism, getting away doesn't happen much. I was a bit suprised when we first pulled into the parking lot. I really didn't expect to see the place layed out quite the way it was. I found the front desk staff were ok. Not rude, just really flat personalities. But I wasn't going to allow that to form my opinion of the whole place. We got the Princess Jr. Suite. I was a little suprised by how "dated" the room appeared. The whirlpool I thought was pretty cool though. Not quite "Heart" shaped, but plenty big enough for two. I read complaints about the "canopy" bed, and I thought it was pretty interesting how they made the canopy bed. I actually stole the idea, and plan on making the make shift canopy beds for my daughters. I did encounter opened toiletries. I would really suggest the cleaning staff check to make sure the seals haven't been opened when they do their cleaning. We did have dinner at the restaraunt, and I didn't think it was all that bad. I had the fettucini alfredo with chicken, and my husband had the chicken parm. We were waited on promptly, and enjoyed having a quiet dinner to ourselves. We had the chocolate covered strawberries that were waiting in our fridge when we arrived. They actually were really good. I did have a vending machine eat $5, but hey that happens everywhere! I didn't find the bed terribly uncomfortable. I have slept on much worse at higher end hotels! I just enjoyed having time alone with my husband for a change. We got up in the morning for our complimentary breakfast. I was actually impressed by the size of the breakfast buffet. Pretty much had everything imaginable, and the wait staff was really nice. We actually were seated, and given the remote control for the TV in case we didn't like what was on. We ate our fill (which was way too much!), and were on our way shortly after. Needless to say, our stay wasn't horrible. I know they are in the process of renovating, and changing management can have its own set of problems. But I guess my husband and I have an adventurous side, and we just took things as they came. I would definitley recommend that they update the rooms, but all in all it wasn't horrible. And this comes from someone that has stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth, and The Hyatt in Boston. For the price, it was worth it. I've paid $350 a night for hotels (Hyatt in Boston), and I didn't have as much fun. If you are expecting the Four Seasons, then this may not be the place for you. But if you are looking for a place to unwind, get away from the kids, and just have some fun with your spouse, then this may be the place for you. You must have a sense of adventure!
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jacuzzi didn't work (not hot water). Called the front desk, they said all rooms were occupied. Paid for what I didn't use. It was my wedding anniversary... not fun!!!. :(
reviews.title: HORRIBLE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was very poor. The staff seemed far more interested in telephone inquiries than any paying guest that were standing in front of them. The two guys manning the front desk didn't seem to know what they were doing. One of them checked us into the wrong room and charged us the full amount for the much pricier suite I had reserved. I wasn't happy with the room and asked for a refund. When I noticed what had happened I asked to see the 'Right' room, which on the face of it we were happy to take.
reviews.title: Dreadful and Outdated. Avoid this place. It's cheap for a reason!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, the first guy tells the second guy to void our refund. he does this but then also charges us AGAIN! this results in a double charge. This mess took over 90 mins to sort out.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only ended up staying in the room for a total of one night. During the night we were awoken by water leaking through the ceiling.
reviews.title: Bad customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was the last straw and we tried to check out at 8:30 the next morning but were told by the girl on the front desk that she 'couldn't check us out and cancel the other two nights and that we would have to see the manager who wouldn't be in until 10:00am.
reviews.title: nice room for the price
Run Down, Horrible Hospitality- One the worst experiences of my life!!!!
reviews.text: I work with hotels on a daily basis for my profession and I have never received worse hospitality and disgusting room conditions in my life. For my anniversary my husband to me to this hotel at a surprised, he rented out the most expensive room in the hotel, which was 413.09 for one night in November (there off season). When I am paying 400 dollars a night I expect a nice hotel not Hotel 8! I room was missing toilet paper, multiple lights were broken. But to make matters worse the hot tub jet was broken and shot out a vast amount of water all over the room, when my husband went to fix it he broke his toe. When called to have someone clean it and bring first aid, no one at the front desk spoke English!!! I known English speaking employee came up and brought a piece of gauze and cleaned the water. The following week we spent everyday talking to Manager, who was the rudest person I have ever met in my whole life! I always spoke calmly with him, and all he would do is talk over me and not allow me to say anything to him after I listened patiently to what he had to say. We never were reimbursed; please take my advice NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! I wish someone had told me this before I did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: Was a 2 night for 1 special. Thisd inculded free dinner the first night. My gf got stuffed lobster and I had fishermans platter. Think it would have been better if the fishermen threw it back overboard. The lobster was what looked way under a pound and very little meat. The only thing tasty on the fishermans platter were the onion rings.
reviews.title: Stay Away Stay Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed on Aug14. For the price we paid we liked it very much. Very large room (not our tayste in decor) but Clean. King sized bed, couch, flat screen TV, clock radio, and a bath room like you see at a 5 star resort. Double sink and shower. Breakfast bufet with eggs, bacon, susage, potato's, danish. Will be back.
reviews.title: Great price, Very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is renewed. The rooms are big the breakfast is great!!!! Nice pool and the location is the best
reviews.title: VERY GOOD HOTEL. GREAT LOCATION AND GOOD SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family book us here for our 25th Anniversary unfortunately we became ill and were not able to go on the trip. I called and tried to cancel on Monday morning at 7am-we were suppose to check in on Tuesday afternoon. The girl that answered the phone was extremely RUDE. She would not allow me to cancel it because they needed 72 hours notice. I tried to explain to her that we were sick and that I could provide a Dr. note but she was every unreasonable. I finally was able to speak to a manager after calling back several times during the day. She told me we would only be charged for one day. Today i get the credit card statement- they did refund me 519.83 then turned around on the same day and charged me 346.55 and 173.28. I have now called three times and can't seem to get anywhere.Everytime I call Gwen is either busy checking people in, not there, or has just stepped away. I was told she would call me back so, I will wait for her call for now then I will have to call the credit card company. It is amazing that they are still in business having the people skills that they have. So do yourself a favor find another place to stay. The staff needs to go to a customer service class and learn how to treat people! I think they have forgotten that if people don't stay there the business doesn't run. We did make it to the Cape and stayed at the Capecodder which is a beautiful hotel and the staff is Wonderful!!!! Maybe Cuddles and Bubbles should ask them for advise on how to treat people!!!
reviews.title: A good place to AVOID

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the interior is outdated. It would be great if the curtains matched the bedspread, but that not how I choose a hotel! It was relatively clean, the staff was courteous and theres a huge jacuzzi in every room! For the price i think it was wonderful! I would stay here again.
reviews.title: For the price- it could not have been better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry but i had to quote Louis ck, since he will be performing at the melody tent, which incidentally, is only a couple of blocks away. I booked the room through the expedia and I did so because for a couple of extra bucks we were able to reserve a Jacuzzi suite instead of just a plain old room offered at other hotels in the area. THEN, i decided to read the reviews and i immediately started to get nervous. OMG, the reviews were down right harsh, so i decided that after our stay here, i was obligated to write a glowing review to counter the horror stories scribbled throughout the web’s vastness. Downtown Hyannis was a buzz w/ activity that night, so it was comforting knowing that we had a parking spot waiting for us right in the middle of it all. Check-in was quick and efficient due to the friendly, well-staffed front desk. We reserved a princess suite, but we were upgraded to a royal Victorian suite. Was the room tacky? Yes, yes, in fact, it was. Again it was Victorian styled and it was very unique compared to a regular hotel room. Do you have any idea how much the room’s color scheme effected our ability to sleep on a comfy, clean king size bed? God only knows. The only thing that interrupted our slumber was the yahoo who parked right in front of our bedroom w/ his flashers on, so I immediately called the front desk to complain, after all, it’s their responsibility to control every person’s, every action, every second of every day. Actually I didn’t, instead I opened the curtains and gave the yahoo a wtf look. After sighting Casper the tired and unfriendly ghost in his skivvies, the flashers were quickly extinguished. Oh, and then the next morning we were forced to partake in this so-called “complementary breakfast”. Auch, it was just dreadful, so dreadful in fact, I went back for more delicious link sausage, succulent scrambled eggs (who cares if they’re instant), tasty home fries, and mouth-watering bacon. Dude, they had bacon, nuff said! Oh wait, now I remember the most traumatic moment of our dining experience, my gf had lipstick on her coffee cup and the utterly uncouth staff had the nerve to immediately replace it w/ brand new piping hot one. Can you believe that? And then get this, the French toast was a little on the cold side, so when we asked the waiter if he would be able to give our French toast a quick, little nukey, nuke, do you know what he had the audacity to retort our simple request with? “Yes, sir, no problem. I apologize for that and we should be bringing some fresh French toast out shortly. I’ll be right back.” I KNOW RIGHT, UNBEIVIBLE! Obviously my review is laced w/ sarcasm and since a font has not yet been devised to aid the cynically challenged, here it is in black and white: The room was clean and comfortable. There were no bugs (of any kind), nor was there hair everywhere. The tub was enormous and the double showerheads were soul soothing. The exhaust fan was loud and the suspended ceiling was drooping a bit, but alas, I was spending an evening here, not procuring a domicile for my ultimate eternity. My only complaint w/ our entire sojourn was the creepy guy residing across the hall from us, but I’m quite certain he had the exact same complaint.
reviews.title: Everything is amazing and nobody is happy'
what a dump
reviews.text: we were looking for a nice place for our anniversary so me and the wife and another couple went to cuddles and bubbles now the rooms look really nice on the website but you pull up and it reminds you of something out of the 1970s with the long curtains and it just looked run down. we checked in and went to our rooms the hallways smelled like chlorine and we were almost expecting to find a indoor pool which there wasnt one. we went to a nice little irish pub for dinner which was very good then went back to the inn for a few drinks in the lounge. the floor was missing tiles and the drinks were just ok. we went back to our rooms for the night the jacuzzi was nice just make sure you dont underfill it thats why i think the hallways smell like that. the bed felt like a 2 inch piece of foam on a piece or plywood it moved alot the covers kept coming off and we both woke up with severe back pain. all in all it was a terrrible experience and i would suggest looking around before booking so quick

reviews.title: I realy liked this place
reviews.text: My many stays at cuddles and Bubbles have always been good ones. I have always enjoyed the hospitality, the food, and the rooms. One point for all if you don't like smoking then just state you want a non smoking room. I have never had a problem with the cleanliness. I love going there. Im always looking for the specials that they usually have.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: R. Rodrigues
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I of three years heard about the inn and decided it would be nice to stay overnight to relax and just get away from it all together. The area the inn is in is unbeatable. Location-wise, it is a two minute drive to the beach, right on a street that all the cute shops and a five minute drive to the mall. The area is perfect for romantic getaways.
reviews.title: Not very cuddly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I thought that the room was purely false advertisement. The website boasts all rooms have a large two person jacuzzi in the room. We got the cheapest room, for we were only staying one night. The jacuzzi was not in the room, but it was the tub in the bathroom. It only had four jets that had little pressure. The "hot water" was no where near being hot. The room was poorly decorated, everything was pink. I felt like we were staying at a cheap motel. I am guessing the more expensive rooms were much nicer. The pictures looked unbelievable, so if we were to go again, we would get the much more expensive one.
reviews.title: Great deal and a nice meal
Never again
reviews.text: This place is way too over rated. My fiance booked a romantic weekend for us- which turned out to be anything but 'romantic'. When we pulled up the grounds was nothing short of a concreit building with a parking lot surrounding it. No grass, no landscaping whatsoever. After we checked in we went to our rooms, the hallway smelled bad and upon entering our room we were shocked at the 'cheesy' decor. The room in which we (thought) booked pictured a large room with a king size bed & a lavish jacuzzi surrounded by mirrors just off to the side (upscale)... but the room we stood in looked instead like a cheesy Ho Jo's special...there was a full size bed with a mirror on the headboard, and the jacuzzi was in the bathroom/bathtub 2 inches away from the toilet and so small that both of us couldn't even fit in it. My fiance said right away that there must be some kind of mistake and headed to the front desk to complain. He came back upset and told me that they said there was no mistake and this was the room we booked. Needless to say any anticipated 'romantic urges' we had before arriving dissapated quickly. We left immediatly -(trying to make the best of it) went to a pub next door to have some drinks thinking if we got a buzz maybe the room would look better later in the night. Upon examining the room later, there were ciggarette burns and stains all over the carpet and the room smelled of mold. The complimentory dinner they offered was nothing to brag about either. The dining room & lounge that they advertise in pictures (with the gazebo) looks far more lavishing in photos. The place had seating for approx a few hundred yet there was only about 5 couples in the entire place. The food was just okay. In our opinion, the pub next door was by far a better more fun place to be- so we headed back there. All in all we tried to make the best of it, but would NEVER go back again or recommend it to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: You ever have a hotel experience that was made enjoyable by the people you're with, and the surrounding area, but the hotel was dismal? This is the experience that my girlfriend of 5 years and I had at the International Inn.
reviews.title: Website Lies Lead to Question: Where's the Vibrating Bed?
Big Mistake
reviews.text: The first and most notable issue that I have with this hotel is its website presense when compared to the actual rooms. For our stay, we stayed in the "Princess Jr. Suite," a so-called smaller version of the Princess Suite. The pictures on the website of quite nice, and I admit, as a marketing technique, your sales pictures should look just slightly more inviting than real life. However, there is no the nice website with the dump you check into.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: To call the room "Smaller" is laughable. You can enter the hot tub by stepping of the king-sized bed. The room, and the hotel in general, smells terrible - a mixture of poorly covered smoke (in the so-called "non-smoking area" no less), rotting ocean plants and wet sand. The odor alone nearly sent me out the door - only my choice to try and enjoy this vacation with my significant other kept me there.
reviews.title: Thank you International Inn
Great Place
reviews.text: The website strikes another failure in the text description. Many of the rooms are described as having nice marble floors, which is not the case. Indeed, there is marble, but the quality is poor, and their age is showing. As is the age of the two-person hot tub - the wall controlled timer for the tub jets managed to jam itself at the 15 minutes mark, leaving two frustrated guests stranded in the hot tub, trying to figure out how to turn the water off without soaking out bedlinen. Because the controls were farther from the tub than the bed was.

reviews.title: Best hot tub hotel
reviews.text: We stayed there on the 21st of February and it was great. There is no better hotel that has a selection of jacuzzis and ways to impress your special someone. We paid around 150 for the night and it was well worth it. We stayed in a Princess Suite which had a HUGE hot tub and double headed shower. Champagne and strawberries were in our room when we checked in and the dinner was the best FREE dinner ever offered by a hotel. The breakfast was great as well.

aka: International Inn And Suites On Cape Cod Hotel Hyannis
description: The International Inn & Suites is a downtown Hyannis hotel offering romantic hotel accommodations for weekend getaways and vacations in Hyannis, Massachusetts. Our boutique hotel features a variety of unique amenities, romantic guest rooms and Jacuzzi suites, and friendly, professional staff. When you choose the International Inn & Suites, you'll enjoy a variety of unexpected extras, from our superior hotel amenities to our romantic vacation packages and hotel specials. Enjoy our convenient downtown location close to the best family attractions, historic landmarks, outdoor activities, museums, cultural events, shopping, dining, and live entertainment for a fabulous getaway in Cape Cod, Massachusetts.
